newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Avg price of new tranche 2-yr OFZ bond 94.00 pct.
newsitem.headline: Avg price of new tranche 2-yr OFZ bond 94.00 pct.

text.p: A new tranche of the two-year OFZ interest-bearing bond maturing in March 1998 was priced at an average 94.00 percent at an auction on Wednesday to yield an average 118.83 percent, the central bank said.
At the last auction of the previous tranche of the bond on September 18 the paper was priced at an average 91.07 percent to yield an average 107.22 percent.
The paper closed at 92.60 on Tuesday.
Full details of the auction follow:
Issue volume 2.50 trln rbls 2.00 trln rbls
The bond pays its next quarterly coupon on December 11. The coupon has been set at 149,788 roubles, equivalent to an annual rate of 60.08 percent, less accruals of 92,177.23 roubles.

On Wednesday the finance ministry also raised 5.95 trillion roubles by selling 7.99 trillion roubles worth of six-month T-bills (series 22057). The ministry's total proceeds from today auctions are 7.4 trillion roubles.

The finance ministry has repaid about 5.97 trillion roubles in a maturing issue of six-month T-bills (series 22032) and paid about 1.02 trillion roubles in interest on the two-year government bonds (series 24006).
